articles.description: Wales prepare to face Finland in Euro 2024 qualifying play-off plus all the latest football updates.
articles.title: Latest football news and international updates

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton says there is "no transparency and no accountability" in Formula 1 as the sport continues to be rocked by off-track wrangles.
articles.title: Lewis Hamilton says F1 hard to trust with no accountability in the sport

articles.description: Former Manchester City and Real Madrid forward Robinho must serve a nine-year rape sentence in his home country of Brazil, a court rules.
articles.title: Ex-Brazil star Robinho told to serve nine-year rape sentence

articles.description: Australian Open champion Aryna Sabalenka asks for privacy after the 'unthinkable tragedy' of the death of her former boyfriend.
articles.title: Aryna Sabalenka: Konstantin Koltsov death in Miami is 'unthinkable tragedy'

articles.description: Wales head coach Ioan Cunningham names his matchday squad for their opening Women's Six Nations game against Scotland.
articles.title: Hesketh to make Wales debut in Six Nations opener

articles.description: England's Emily Scarratt could move to inside centre in the Women's Six Nations, says head coach John Mitchell.
articles.title: Mitchell considers Scarratt move to inside centre

articles.description: An arrest warrant is issued for Detroit Lions defensive back Cameron Sutton who is wanted in connection with an alleged domestic violence incident.
articles.title: Cameron Sutton: Arrest warrant issued for Detroit Lions defensive back

articles.description: Andy Murray earns a much-needed win over an ailing Matteo Berrettini in Miami, with fellow Briton Jack Draper also through.
articles.title: Miami Open: Andy Murray beats Matteo Berrettini, Jack Draper also through

articles.description: Ippei Mizuhara, who is accused of illegal gambling, has been a constant companion of the baseball star.
articles.title: Shohei Ohtani's interpreter fired after reports of theft

articles.description: Newcastle forward Anthony Gordon says playing for Scotland was "never a thought" after receiving his first call-up to the senior England squad.
articles.title: Scotland 'never a thought' for England's Gordon
